From: Gordon Mohr <gojomo@...>
Subject: FYI: MAX_OUTLINKS default 6000 Re: [archive-crawler] Slowdown in
 LinkScoper?
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=137285340; y=O_nd-SPkArk66bNfZt35OmlxG7Sy51El0225W26OlLYw
X-Yahoo-Profile: gojomo

I wrote in the previous message:
> (1) Do the URIs they're working on have a gigantic number of outlinks? [*]

[*] Not a potential cause of the slowdown, but related: A new feature
in CVS HEAD sets a cap on the number of links that can be found in any
page, as a guard against extreme junk and extreme memory usage. (The
temporary collection of extracted links pending scope-checking is not
overflowed to disk.)

The default is 6000 links, chosen rather arbitrarily. It's held by
CrawlURI.MAX_OUTLINKS, and can be overridden by using the
'org.archive.crawler.datamodel.CrawlURI.maxOutLinks' system property.

If more links are discovered, they are discarded, but an annotation is
added to the URI "dol:[# of outlinks discarded]". 'Annotations' appear
at the end of the URI's line in the crawl.log.

- Gordon @ IA
